alert.note: Alert for Baker; Harney; Malheur (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 18 at 11:35AM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...REMNANTS OF HURRICANE HILARY BRINGING SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE LATE SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY... Deep tropical moisture is forecast to move northward into the Intermountain West late Sunday and lasting at least through Tuesday. The moisture, atmospheric instability, and weak lift associated with the decaying remnants of Hurricane Hilary will aid in the potential for moderate to heavy rainfall that could lead to flash flooding. Steep terrain and wildfire burn scars will be especially susceptible to rock/mud slides and debris flows. Localized rainfall rates may reach 2 to 3 inches per hour with potentially record breaking amounts of atmospheric moisture present. Hydrologic impacts will strongly depend on the track and strength of remnants from Hurricane Hilary. Given this uncertainty, a wide array of rainfall amounts and potential impacts are possible. Stay tuned to the latest hydrologic forecasts at www.weather.gov/boise and www.nhc.noaa.gov.
